member.name: T:System.Text.Encodings.Web.OptimizedInboxTextEncoder
member.summary: Allows efficient escaping for the library's built-in types (HTML, URL, JS). Assumes the following: (a) All C0 and C1 code points are disallowed. (b) Escaping 1 ASCII input character results in no more than 6 output characters. (c) All Unicode scalar values may be represented in escaped form. (d) The escaped form of any Unicode scalar value consists of only ASCII characters.

member.name: T:System.Text.Encodings.Web.OptimizedInboxTextEncoder.AllowedAsciiCodePoints
member.summary: A bitmap which represents allowed ASCII code points.

member.name: T:System.Text.Encodings.Web.OptimizedInboxTextEncoder.AsciiPreescapedData
member.summary:
A bitmap which represents the 64-bit pre-escaped form of the ASCII code points. A pre-escaped code point has the form [ WW 00 FF EE DD CC BB AA ], where AA - FF are the six-ASCII-byte escaped representation of the code point, zero-padded at the end. The high byte of the pre-escaped form is the number of non-zero bytes which make up the pre-escaped data.
Example: If the escaped form of "@" is "%40", the pre-escaped form will be: 0x30_00_00_00_00_30_34_25. Iterate over the least significant bytes one-by-one to reconstruct the escaped representation, stopping when you hit a null byte.

member.name: M:System.Text.Encodings.Web.OptimizedInboxTextEncoder.IsScalarValueAllowed(System.Text.Rune)
member.summary: Given a scalar value, returns a value stating whether that value is present in this encoder's allow list.

member.summary: Represents a type used to do JavaScript encoding/escaping.

member.name: P:System.Text.Encodings.Web.JavaScriptEncoder.UnsafeRelaxedJsonEscaping
member.summary: Returns a built-in instance of that is less strict about what gets encoded.

remarks.para: Unlike the , this encoder instance does not escape HTML-sensitive characters like <, >, &, etc. and hence must be used cautiously (for example, if the output data is within a response whose content-type is known with a charset set to UTF-8).
Unlike the , the quotation mark is encoded as \" rather than \u0022.
Unlike the (which only allows ), using this encoder instance allows to go through unescaped.
Unlike the , this encoder instance allows some other characters to go through unescaped (for example, '+'), and hence must be used cautiously.

member.name: M:System.Text.UnicodeUtility.IsValidCodePoint(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns iff is a valid Unicode code point, i.e., is in [ U+0000..U+10FFFF ], inclusive.

member.name: M:System.Text.UnicodeUtility.IsValidUnicodeScalar(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns iff is a valid Unicode scalar value, i.e., is in [ U+0000..U+D7FF ], inclusive; or [ U+E000..U+10FFFF ], inclusive.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to indicate a source generator should create a function for marshalling arguments instead of relying on the runtime to generate an equivalent marshalling function at run-time.
member.remarks: This attribute is meaningless if the source generator associated with it is not enabled. The current built-in source generator only supports C# and only supplies an implementation when applied to static, partial, non-generic methods.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .
member.param: Name of the library containing the import.

member.summary: Gets the name of the library containing the import.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the entry point to be called.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute.StringMarshalling
member.summary: Gets or sets how to marshal string arguments to the method.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute.StringMarshallingCustomType
member.summary: Gets or sets the used to control how string arguments to the method are marshalled.
member.remarks: If this field is specified, must not be specified or must be set to .
